main.name: Style Guide
main.description: For The Ted Stevens Center for Arctic Security Studies
main.bio: The Ted Stevens Center For Arctic Security Studies has many inspirations and influences from the arctic region integrated into it's branding. Aspects of native culture, natural phenomena, arctic widlife and regional customs shape the way the center is to be viewed. The Ted Stevens Center operates in the spirit of trust and cooperation and this is to be visually apparent. Visual components such as: 'the northern lights', 'ice, wind and waves', 'the raven', 'natural and rugged beauty' and 'the serious / critical nature of the centers mission' are all common visual themes and motifs that should be present throughout all of the branding.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

logo.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

colorPalette.primaryText: Tone and shade To be used for design objects and background gradient, tint to be used on objects with a higher z-index, ex: cards, chips, design elements used to create a sense of depth above background.
colorPalette.accentsText: Highlight important objects, calls to action, links, buttons. Not to be used for copy or headline text, card titles, or navigation. Not to be used on light or highly saturated images without dark base background object.
colorPalette.tintsShadesText: Tint and tone to be used for copy or headline text, card titles, or navigation. Not to be used on light or highly saturated images without shade base background object. H hierarchy when both are used in conjuction and are visually close should use #f2f2f2 for H level that is higher ex: H1 -> #f2f2f2, H2 -> c5c5c5. Shade is to create depth, veither in background or on objects that are placed over images.

fonts.headingText: Tone and shade To be used for design objects and background gradient, tint to be used on objects with a higher z-index, ex: cards, chips, design elements used to create a sense of depth above background.

h1.font: Bierstadt: weight: bold, Size: 48px / 3.44rem, letter-spacing: 1.36px, line-height: auto

h2.font: Bierstadt: weight: regular, Size: 20px / 1.25rem, letter-spacing: 2px, line-height: auto

h3.font: Bierstadt: weight: regular, Size: 19px / 1.1875rem, letter-spacing: 2px, line-height: auto

h4.font: Bierstadt: weight: bold, Size: 16px / 1.14rem, letter-spacing: 4%, line-height: auto

h5.font: Bierstadt: weight: bold, Size: 13px / 0.92rem, letter-spacing: 4%, line-height: auto

fonts.paragraphText: Tone and shade To be used for design objects and background gradient, tint to be used on objects with a higher z-index, ex: cards, chips, design elements used to create a sense of depth above background.

p.font: Bierstadt: weight: regular, Size: 14px / 1rem, letter-spacing: 7%, line-height: auto

span.font: Bierstadt: weight: regular, Size: 12px / 0.75rem, letter-spacing: 0, line-height: auto

figcaption.font: Bierstadt: weight: regular, Size: 10px / 0.625rem, letter-spacing: 0, line-height: auto

em.font: Bierstadt: weight: regular, font-style: italic, Size: 10px / 1rem, letter-spacing: 0, line-height: auto
